Eventually, Alwyn settled in Los Angeles, where he enrolled at the University of California, Berkeley, where he earned his Ph.D. In 1951, Alwyn began his long-running work The Room, a laboratory of sorts where he experimented with the appearance, composition, and movement of photographic materials. A film adaptation of the same project, The Body Shop, was made in 1954.
